member.name: T:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Converter.CurrencyTypeConverter
member.summary: A TypeConverter that support string conversion from and to string with the currency symbol. Support Conversion for Float, Double and Decimal, Int

member.name: T:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Converter.NumberTypeConverter
member.summary: A TypeConverter that support string conversion from and to string with a custom format number. Support Conversion for Float, Double and Decimal, Int

member.summary: Summary description for DateTimeTypeConverter.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Converter.DateTimeTypeConverter.DateTimeStyles
member.summary: DateTimeStyle for Parse operations. DefaultValue: AllowInnerWhite|AllowLeadingWhite|AllowTrailingWhite|AllowWhiteSpaces

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Converter.DateTimeTypeConverter.Format
member.summary: Format of the Date. Example: G, g, d, D. Default value : G

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Converter.DateTimeTypeConverter.ParseFormats
member.summary: Formats to check when parse the string. If null call with no format the parse method. Default value: null

member.name: T:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Converter.PercentTypeConverter
member.summary: A TypeConverter that support string conversion from and to string with the percent symbol. Support Conversion for Float, Double and Decimal

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Converter.PercentTypeConverter.ConsiderAllStringAsPercent
member.summary: If true and the user insert a string with no percent symbel the value is divided by 100, otherwise not.

member.name: T:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator
member.summary: An interface to support string conversion and validation. Object = an object not yet converted for the current validator, Value = an object already converted and valid for the current validator, String = a string that can be used for conversion to and from Value, DisplayString = a string representation of the Value

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsNullString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string is null or if is equals to the NullString

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.ObjectToValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Convert an object according to the current ValueType of the validator

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.ValueToObject(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Convert a value valid for the current validator ValueType to an object with the Type specified. Throw an exception on error.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.ValueToString(System.Object)
member.summary: Convert a value valid for the current validator ValueType to a string that can be used for other conversions, for example StringToValue method.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.StringToValue(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string to an object according to the type of the string editor

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsStringConversionSupported
member.summary: Returns true if string conversion is suported. AllowStringConversion must be true and the current Validator must support string conversion.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.ValueToDisplayString(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a value valid for this validator valuetype to a string representation. The string cannot be used for conversion. If the validator support string conversion this method simply call ValueToString otherwise call Value.ToString()

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsValidValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if the value is valid for this type of editor without any conversion.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsValidObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if the object is valid for this type of validator, using conversion functions.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsValidObject(System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns true if the object is valid for this type of validator, using conversion functions. Returns as parameter the value converted.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsValidString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string is valid for this type of editor, using string conversion function.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsValidString(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns true if the string is valid for this type of editor, using string conversion function. An returns the object converted.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.IsInStandardValues(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if the value specified is presents in the list StandardValues.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.StandardValueAtIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the standard values at the specified index. If StandardValues support IList use simple the indexer method otherwise loop troght the collection.

member.name: M:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.StandardValuesIndexOf(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the index of the specified standard value. -1 if not found. If StandardValues support IList use simple the indexer method otherwise loop troght the collection.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.AllowNull
member.summary: True to allow null object value or NullString string Value

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.NullString
member.summary: Null string representation. A string is null when is null or when is equals to this string. Default is empty string. Used by ValueToString and StringToValue

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.NullDisplayString
member.summary: Null string representation. A string is null when is null or when is equals to this string. Default is empty string. Used by ValueToDisplayString

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.AllowStringConversion
member.summary: Gets or Sets if the string conversion is allowed.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.MinimumValue
member.summary: Minimum value allowed. If null no check is performed. The value must derive from IComparable interface to use Minimum or Maximum feature.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.MaximumValue
member.summary: Maximum value allowed. If null no check is performed. The value must derive from IComparable interface to use Minimum or Maximum feature.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.ValueType
member.summary: Type allowed for the current editor. Cannot be null.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.DefaultValue
member.summary: Default value for this editor, usually is the default value for the specified type.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.StandardValues
member.summary: A list of values that this editor can support. If StandardValuesExclusive is true then the editor can only support one of these values.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.StandardValuesExclusive
member.summary: If StandardValuesExclusive is true then the editor can only support the list specified in StandardValues.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.ComponentModel.Validator.IValidator.CultureInfo
member.summary: Culture for conversion. If null the default user culture is used. Default is null.

member.name: T:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage
member.summary: A custom extender class that adds a MenuImage attribute to MenuItem objects, and custom drawns the menu with an icon stored in a referenced ImageList control.
member.remarks: This extension was written to provide an simple way to link icons in an Imagelist with a menu, and owner draw the menu. Other menu icon samples sub-class a MenuItem which interferes with the Visual Studio IDE for designing menus. Other examples required a lot of custom tooling and hand-coding. By using an extender, no custom coding is required.

member.name: F:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage.IMAGE_BUFFER
member.summary: Menu images should be 16 x 16

member.name: F:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage._hashTable
member.summary: Hashtable is used to relate added MenuItem components with each custom status messsage attribute value.

member.name: F:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage._imageList
member.summary: Holds a reference to the user selected StatusBar instance where custom statusmessage attribute values are displayed.

member.name: M:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Constructor for instance that supports Class Composition designer.
member.param: Reference to container hosting this instance.

member.summary: Used to set a MenuImage property value for a specific MenuItem component instance.
member.param: the MenuItem object to store
the image index value to associate with the menu item
member.exception: Image index is not a valid value.

member.summary: Used to retrieve the MenuImage extender property value for a given MenuItem component instance.
member.param: the menu item instance associated with the value
member.returns: Returns the MenuImage index property value for the specified MenuItem component instance.

member.returns: Returns True/False if the component supports the extender.

member.param: the client object to retrieve the menuindex for

the event arguments

the event arguments

a Graphics object provided by the MeasureItem and DrawItem events

member.name: M:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage.MenuHelper.CalcHeight
member.summary: Based on the menu item text, and the SystemInformation.SmallIconSize, performs a calculation to determine the correct MenuItem height.
member.returns: Returns an int value that contains the calculated height of the menu item.

member.name: M:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage.MenuHelper.CalcWidth
member.summary: Based on the menu item text, and the SystemInformation.SmallIconSize, performs a calculation to determine the correct MenuItem width.
member.returns: Returns an int value that contains the calculated width of the menu item.

member.name: M:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage.MenuHelper.HasShortcut
member.summary: A method to evaluate if the MenuItem has a shortcut selected, and the shortcut has been selected for show.
member.returns: Returns True/False whether the menu has a shortcut to be displayed.

member.summary: Evaluates whether the MenuItem is a seperator by evaluating the text.
member.returns: Returns True/False whether the menu is a seperator.

member.name: M:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage.MenuHelper.IsTopLevel
member.summary: Evaluates whether the MenuItem is a top-level menu that is sited directly on a MainMenu control.
member.returns: Returns True/False if the menu item is a top-level menu.

True/False if the menu item is currently selected
the image index of the menu icon to draw, defaults to -1

member.name: M:Chris.Beckett.MenuImageLib.MenuImage.MenuHelper.DrawArrow(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Draws a custom arrow on the right-side edge of the menu to indicate the menu has submenu items. Used to supplement a base contorl arrow that is painted incorrectly (seems to be a bug), and make the arrow appear correctly for longer menu items.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxTyped.EnableLastValidValue
member.summary: True to allow the Value property to always return a valid value when the textbox.text is not valid, false to throw an error when textbox.text is not valid.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.Windows.Forms.TextBoxTyped.ValidCharacters
member.summary: A list of characters allowed for the textbox. Used in the OnKeyPress event. If null no check is made. If not null any others charecters is not allowed. First the function check if ValidCharacters is not null then check for InvalidCharacters.

member.name: P:SourceLibrary.Windows.Forms.TextBoxTyped.InvalidCharacters
member.summary: A list of characters not allowed for the textbox. Used in the OnKeyPress event. If null no check is made. If not null any characters in the list is not allowed. First the function check if ValidCharacters is not null then check for InvalidCharacters.
